result.execSummary:
The defendant George C Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating Commercial Motor Vehicle without a License - WI Resident, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is not to operate any motor vehicle unless he has clearance from a neurologist.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating Commercial Motor Vehicle without a License - WI Resident
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George C Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:26 am case called.16CM46, 16TR199, 16TR173, & 16TR200. Defendant George C Cooper in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement stated-argued sentence. Attorney Lennon and defendant concur.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 16TR173 & 16TR200. 16TR199-NC plea-$221.10 to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 16CM46-Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Lennon. No Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 90 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. CONDITIONS: Not to operate any motor vehilce unless he has clearance from a neurologist. Terms of Agent.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lennon states matter is resolved and requests P/S.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 19, 2017 at 09:55 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant George C Cooper in court, in person, with attorney William Michael Lennon, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lennon just appointed this  morning - he requests slight adjournment to allow for meeting with his client.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 09:55 am.
No operation of any commercial motor vehicles without a valid commercial driver's license.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 3:45 PM w/companion civil citations: Defendant George C Cooper in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and cannot retain his own counsel.  Not employed.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.   NGP entered by the Court as to all matters.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
